In this study, you will be presented with texts from a Social Media platform called Vent, where users can share an emotion and write a corresponding post.
Your task is to choose the emotion that is expressed by the post. If none of the emotions seem to match perfectly, please choose the best possible fit.
The purpose of this study is to compare your classifications with those of LEIA, an emotion detection language model. This model is able to identify the following emotions: Happiness, Sadness, Anger and Fear.
The following table is provided as an aid, to categorize certain emotions to the given emotions.
SadnessLonely, Sad, Miserable
AngerAngry, Annoyed, Frustrated, Furious
FearAnxious, Stressed, Afraid, Nervous, Worried
HappinessHappy, Excited

To better understand the task, please review the following example texts.

 "found my mom's chocolate stash and hellz yeah i'm gonna eat all of this"
 &rarr Happiness

 "I really don't feel like doing anything or going anywhere. I would just like to disappear."
  &rarr Sadness
Some texts may contain emotionally challenging content. Please be mindful of this as you read.

In this study your confidentiality will be maintained in the following manner:
To protect your identity, the researchers will take the following steps: (1) Each participant will be assigned a number; (2) The researchers will record any data collected during the study by number, not by name; (3) Any original recordings or data files will be stored in a secured location accessed only by authorized researchers.
This Study has been approved by the Institutional Review Board (Ethics Committee) of the University of Konstanz (IRB statement 14/2025).
Your participation in this research is voluntary. You may discontinue participation at any time during the research activity.
